hint.metricDescription: Note the block alignment conventions of your programming language. Code that arranges parts of code that are generally considered to belong together. Differently aligned blocks are generally less readable because the reading habits usually correspond to the applicable conventions
hint.goodCodeDescription: This code fulfills all current standards. Examples: - Assignments in same line - Boolean expressions in same line - no linebreaks in method call with 1 argument
hint.badCodeDescription: code is not formatted in the common conventions
